:::{#about-content}

Since June 2024, I am Associate Professor of Economic Sociology at the <a href= https://www.unimi.it/it/ugov/person/emanuela-struffolino> University of Milan, Department of Social and Political Sciences</a>. 

I am a member of the Executive Board of the <a href= https://sequenceanalysis.org/ > SAA-Sequence Analysis Association </a> since 2018. I am Associate Editor of the <a href= https://ubp.uni-bamberg.de/jfr/index.php/jfr> Journal of Family Research</a>, Deputy Editor of <a href= https://read.dukeupress.edu/demography> Demography</a>, and member of the editorial board of <a href= https://www.francoangeli.it/riviste/sommario/83/sociologia-del-lavoro> Sociologia del Lavoro</a>.

Between October 2020 and March 2021, I was guest Professor of Social Policy (W2 Vertretungsprofessur) at the <a href= https://www.sowi.hu-berlin.de/de/lehrbereiche/sozpolsoz/team/1693053> Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin</a>. Between April and September 2020, I was guest Professor of Macrosociology (W3 Vertretungsprofessur) at the Institute of Sociology at the <a href= https://www.polsoz.fu-berlin.de/en/soziologie/arbeitsbereiche/makrosoziologie/mitarbeiter/lehrstuhlinhaber/emanuela-struffolino.html > Freie Universität Berlin </a>. 

Between 2014 to 2019 I was a postdoctoral fellow at the *Swiss National Centre for Competence in Research* <a href= https://www.lives-nccr.ch/en > "LIVES - Overcoming vulnerability: A life-course perspective"</a> at the University of Lausanne, at research group <a href= https://wzb.eu/de/news/demography-and-inequality > "Demography and Inequality"</a> Research Group and then at the the research unit <a href= https://www.wzb.eu/en/research/dynamics-of-social-inequalities/skill-formation-and-labor-markets > "Skill Formation and Labor Markets"</a> at the <a href= https://wzb.eu/de > WZB Berlin Social Science Center</a>. 

I obtained my PhD in Sociology at the <a href= https://www.sociologia.unimib.it/it > University of Milano-Bicocca</a>. 

On this website, you can find information on my publications and ongoing research and teaching.


## Interests

- Labor market 
- Poverty 
- Gender inequalities
- Social stratification
- Social-demography
- Methods
